main_text:
Diachronic Dutch Book Arguments
4. Diachronic Dutch Book Arguments

The basic idea behind the Dutch Book argument for probabilism has been
used in defense of a variety of principles that purport to govern how
beliefs should evolve over time. In each case, it is argued that the
agent who violates the principle is subject to a Dutch Book. Here, the
bets involved are placed at different times, but there is an algorithm
for placing the bets that is available at the outset guaranteeing a
profit to one side. Such arguments are generally referred to as
“Dutch Strategy” arguments.
